label: 化外
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: (alt. kegai) outside the transformed, a place or people not under the civilizing rule of the enlightened Heavenly Monarch, and therefore considered uncivilized. The alternative is kanai 化内 ”within the transformed,” those who are ruled and civilized by the monarch. Such thinking was a basic concept of Chinese-style rulership imported into Japan by the fifth century.
